notes: Reproduced as reported: all SKImage.FromEncodedData and SKBitmap.Decode overloads return null for the attached TIFF file, and SKBitmap.Decode(byte[]) throws ArgumentNullException. SKCodec.Create also returns null, confirming Skia's underlying codec does not support this TIFF format. The TIFF file is a valid 988x664 uncompressed RGB image (confirmed by `file` command). This behavior persists across SkiaSharp 2.88.3, 3.119.2 (latest), and main (source). Note: Skia historically has limited/no TIFF support — this may be a Skia-level limitation rather than a SkiaSharp bug.

versionResults.notes: All decode methods return null or throw ArgumentNullException. SKCodec.Create returns null.
Same behavior as 2.88.3 — all methods return null or throw.
Built test project from source and ran targeted xUnit test. SKCodec.Create, SKImage.FromEncodedData, and SKBitmap.Decode all return null for the TIFF file.

reproductionSteps.output:
inflating: C 7 142 18-0002.tif
-rw-r--r--  matthew  wheel  3977720 May  8  2024 C 7 142 18-0002.tif

reproductionSteps.output: C 7 142 18-0002.tif: TIFF image data, little-endian, direntries=23, height=664, bps=290, compression=none, PhotometricIntepretation=RGB, orientation=upper-left, width=988

reproductionSteps.description: Create a .NET 8 console project with SkiaSharp 2.88.3 (reporter's version)
reproductionSteps.command: dotnet new console -n Repro --framework net8.0 && cd Repro && dotnet add package SkiaSharp --version 2.88.3
reproductionSteps.output:
The template "Console App" was created successfully.
PackageReference for package 'SkiaSharp' version '2.88.3' added.

filesCreated.description: Console project targeting net8.0 with SkiaSharp 2.88.3
Reproduction code testing all 6 decode methods plus SKCodec.Create for TIFF file

reproductionSteps.description: Run reproduction with SkiaSharp 2.88.3 — all decode methods fail for the TIFF file
reproductionSteps.output:
Testing TIF file: test.tif
File exists: True

Result: NULL

--- Test 2: SKImage.FromEncodedData(byte[]) ---
Result: NULL

--- Test 3: SKImage.FromEncodedData(Stream) ---
Result: NULL

--- Test 4: SKBitmap.Decode(string) ---
Result: NULL

--- Test 5: SKBitmap.Decode(byte[]) ---
Exception: ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'codec')

--- Test 6: SKBitmap.Decode(Stream) ---
Result: NULL

--- Test 7: SKCodec.Create(string) ---
Result: NULL (codec creation failed - format not supported)

artifacts.description: Reporter's TIFF test file — 988x664 uncompressed RGB image, ~4MB. Attached as zip to the issue.

errorMessages.primaryError: All SKImage.FromEncodedData and SKBitmap.Decode overloads return null for TIFF files. SKBitmap.Decode(byte[]) throws ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'codec'). SKCodec.Create returns null — TIFF format not recognized by Skia's codec layer.
additionalErrors: ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'codec') at SkiaSharp.SKBitmap.Decode(byte[])
